peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you determine the market value of art?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: By taking into account its historical, aesthetic, and social context, you can determine a fair and equitable price for the artwork that reflects its true worth. Art valuation involves a deep appreciation for the cultural significance of art, as well as the economic and commercial forces that shape the art market.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How To Value Art: A Guide To Art Pricing & Appraisals | MyArtBroker

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find out what my art is worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Consider finding an appraiser to determine the value of your artwork. Appraisers are trained specialists who work for a fee. They evaluate your piece and give you a written statement of its value.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How Much Is Your Object Worth? | Smithsonian American Art Museum

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the fair market value of art?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The fair market or retail value is based on what an item would bring in a retail store, to the average buyer. This value is most often higher than the auction value, because the market is larger.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Comparing Fair Market and Insurance Valuation for Fine Art

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much will my art sell for?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Multiply the painting's width by its length to arrive at the total size, in square inches. Then multiply that number by a set dollar amount that's appropriate for your reputation. I currently use $6 per square inch for oil paintings. Then calculate your cost of canvas and framing, and then double that number.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to Price Your Artwork: This Formula Makes it Easy
